intro: Crataegus pringlei var. exclusa, commonly known as the Mexican hawthorn, is a rare and endemic species native to Mexico. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its thorny stems and clusters of white to pink flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
